member.summary: This method supports control infrastructure and is not intended for use directly from your code. Suspends layout updates forced by document editing operations (e.g. multiple insert/delete operations). Each call to to this method should be followed by a call to method.
member.remarks: Use this method when you have to do sequence of updates to the document, to improve performance and avoid unnecessary layout and UI updates.

member.name: T:Telerik.WinForms.Documents.Model.AnnotationMarkerBase
member.summary: Represents a marker inside a .

member.name: P:Telerik.WinForms.Documents.Model.AnnotationMarkerBase.AnnotationID
member.summary: Gets or sets the annotation identifier.

member.name: P:Telerik.WinForms.Documents.Model.AnnotationMarkerBase.SkipPositionBefore
member.summary:
Determines if the will be put before or after the annotation marker.
If the value of this property is true for an , then if you move the caret to the annotation start and start typing,
the newly inserted text will be considered as part of the annotation. Vice versa, if it is set to false, the typed text will be inserted before the annotation. The behavior of is also controlled in the same manner.
member.value: true if the position before the marker will be skipped; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Telerik.WinForms.Documents.Model.AnnotationMarkerBase.SkipPositionAfter
member.summary:
A negation of the property. If the position before the marker is skipped, then the one after it must not be skipped.
Exactly one of the positions must be skipped.
member.value: true if the position after the marker will be skipped; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Telerik.WinForms.Documents.Model.AnnotationRangeStart.SkipPositionsInRange
member.summary:
Determines if the will be put before or after the annotation marker.
If the value of this property is true for an , then if you move the caret to the annotation start and start typing,
the newly inserted text will be considered as part of the annotation. Vice versa, if it is set to false, the typed text will be inserted before the annotation. The behavior of is also controlled in the same manner.
member.value: true if the position before the marker will be skipped; otherwise, false.

member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the contents of the annotation should be included in the spellcheck.

member.summary:

If the value is true, then a new paragraph with same formatting will be inserted. Otherwise, only the inlines from that paragraph will be inserted.
The default value is true.

member.name: P:Telerik.WinForms.Documents.Model.BookmarkRangeEnd.SkipPositionBefore
member.summary:
Determines if the will be put before or after the annotation marker.
If the value of this property is true for an , then if you move the caret to the annotation start and start typing,
the newly inserted text will be considered as part of the annotation. Vice versa, if it is set to false, the typed text will be inserted before the annotation. The behavior of is also controlled in the same manner.
member.value: true if the position before the marker will be skipped; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Telerik.WinForms.Documents.Model.Notes.MarkRangeEndBase.SkipPositionBefore
member.summary:
Determines if the will be put before or after the annotation marker.
If the value of this property is true for an , then if you move the caret to the annotation start and start typing,
the newly inserted text will be considered as part of the annotation. Vice versa, if it is set to false, the typed text will be inserted before the annotation. The behavior of is also controlled in the same manner.
member.value: true if the position before the marker will be skipped; otherwise, false.

member.summary: Determines whether the annotation should be treated as word separator.

member.name: P:Telerik.WinForms.Documents.Model.PermissionRangeEnd.SkipPositionBefore
member.summary:
Determines if the will be put before or after the annotation marker.
If the value of this property is true for an , then if you move the caret to the annotation start and start typing,
the newly inserted text will be considered as part of the annotation. Vice versa, if it is set to false, the typed text will be inserted before the annotation. The behavior of is also controlled in the same manner.
member.value: true if the position before the marker will be skipped; otherwise, false.

member.name: T:Telerik.WinForms.Documents.Model.ReadOnlyRangeEnd
member.summary: Represents the end marker for a read only range in a .

member.name: P:Telerik.WinForms.Documents.Model.ReadOnlyRangeEnd.SkipPositionBefore
member.summary:
Determines if the will be put before or after the annotation marker.
If the value of this property is true for an , then if you move the caret to the annotation start and start typing,
the newly inserted text will be considered as part of the annotation. Vice versa, if it is set to false, the typed text will be inserted before the annotation.
member.value: true if the position before the marker will be skipped; otherwise, false.

member.name: F:Telerik.WinForms.Documents.Model.StructuredDocumentTags.SdtCalendar.Gregorian
member.summary: Specifies that the Gregorian calendar, as defined in ISO 8601, shall be used. This calendar should be localized into the appropriate language.

member.name: F:Telerik.WinForms.Documents.Model.StructuredDocumentTags.SdtCalendar.GregorianUS
member.summary: Specifies that the Gregorian calendar, as defined in ISO 8601, shall be used. The values for this calendar should be represented in English.

member.name: F:Telerik.WinForms.Documents.Model.StructuredDocumentTags.SdtCalendar.GregorianMeFrench
member.summary: Specifies that the Gregorian calendar, as defined in ISO 8601, shall be used. The values for this calendar should be presented in Middle East French.

member.name: F:Telerik.WinForms.Documents.Model.StructuredDocumentTags.SdtCalendar.GregorianArabic
member.summary: Specifies that the Gregorian calendar, as defined in ISO 8601, shall be used. The values for this calendar should be presented in Arabic.

member.name: F:Telerik.WinForms.Documents.Model.StructuredDocumentTags.SdtCalendar.Hijri
member.summary: Specifies that the Hijri lunar calendar shall be used.

member.name: F:Telerik.WinForms.Documents.Model.StructuredDocumentTags.SdtCalendar.Hebrew
member.summary: Specifies that the Hebrew lunar calendar shall be used.

member.name: F:Telerik.WinForms.Documents.Model.StructuredDocumentTags.SdtCalendar.Taiwan
member.summary: Specifies that the Taiwanese calendar, as defined by the Chinese National Standard CNS 7648, shall be used.

member.name: F:Telerik.WinForms.Documents.Model.StructuredDocumentTags.SdtCalendar.Japan
member.summary: Specifies that the Japanese Emperor Era calendar, as described by Japanese Industrial Standard JIS X 0301, shall be used.

member.name: F:Telerik.WinForms.Documents.Model.StructuredDocumentTags.SdtCalendar.Thai
member.summary: Specifies that the Thai calendar shall be used.

member.name: F:Telerik.WinForms.Documents.Model.StructuredDocumentTags.SdtCalendar.Korea
member.summary: Specifies that the Korean Tangun Era calendar, as described by Korean Law Enactment No. 4, shall be used.

member.name: F:Telerik.WinForms.Documents.Model.StructuredDocumentTags.SdtCalendar.Saka
member.summary: Specifies that the Saka Era calendar shall be used.

member.name: F:Telerik.WinForms.Documents.Model.StructuredDocumentTags.SdtCalendar.GregorianXlitEnglish
member.summary: Specifies that the Gregorian calendar, as defined in ISO 8601, shall be used. The values for this calendar should be the representation of the English strings in the corresponding Arabic characters

member.name: F:Telerik.WinForms.Documents.Model.StructuredDocumentTags.SdtCalendar.GregorianXlitFrench
member.summary: Specifies that the Gregorian calendar, as defined in ISO 8601, shall be used. The values for this calendar should be the representation of the French strings in the corresponding Arabic characters

member.name: F:Telerik.WinForms.Documents.Model.StructuredDocumentTags.SdtCalendar.None

member.name: P:Telerik.WinForms.Documents.Model.Styles.StyleDefinition.BasedOnName
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of base style
member.remarks: StyleDefinition inherits its property values from BasedOn style. Either BasedOn or BasedOnName can be specified. If BasedOnName is specified BasedOn StyleDefinition would be set automatically if this style definition is added to a document StyleRepository that contains StyleDefinition with corresponding Name.

member.name: P:Telerik.WinForms.Documents.Model.Styles.StyleDefinition.BasedOn
member.summary: Gets or sets the base StyleDefinition
member.remarks: StyleDefinition inherits its property values from BasedOn style. Either BasedOn or BasedOnName can be specified. If BasedOnName is specified BasedOn StyleDefinition would be set automatically if this style definition is added to a document StyleRepository that contains StyleDefinition with corresponding Name.

member.name: P:Telerik.WinForms.Documents.Model.Styles.StyleDefinition.LinkedStyleName
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the linked style.
member.remarks: This property can be set to Paragraph or Character style only. Paragraph style can be linked only to Character style and vice versa. StyleDefinition would obtain the corresponding property values from the linked style. Either LinkedStyle or LinkedStyleName can be specified. If BasedOnName is specified BasedOn StyleDefinition would be set automatically if this style definition is added to a document StyleRepository that contains StyleDefinition with corresponding Name.

member.name: P:Telerik.WinForms.Documents.Model.Styles.StyleDefinition.LinkedStyle
member.summary: Gets or sets linked StyleDefinition. Only Paragraph and Character types of styles can be linked
member.remarks: This property can be set to Paragraph or Character style only. Paragraph style can be linked only to Character style and vice versa. StyleDefinition would obtain the corresponding property values from the linked style. Either LenkedStyle or LinkedStyleName can be specified. If BasedOnName is specified BasedOn StyleDefinition would be set automatically if this style definition is added to a document StyleRepository that contains StyleDefinition with corresponding Name.

member.summary: Gets a length of all quantization table parameters.

member.name: P:Telerik.WinForms.Documents.Core.Imaging.Jpeg.Tables.QuantizationTable.Precision
member.summary: Gets Quantization table element precision.
member.remarks: CCITT T.81, Annex B, section B.2.4.1 Quantization table-specification syntax (see Pq parameter in the Table B.4). Specifies the precision of the Qk values. Value 0 indicates 8-bit Qk values; value 1 indicates 16-bit Qk values. Pq shall be zero for 8 bit sample precision P (see B.2.2).

member.name: M:Telerik.WinForms.Documents.Core.Imaging.Jpeg.Tables.QuantizationTable.Read(Telerik.WinForms.Documents.Core.Imaging.Jpeg.Decoder.IJpegReader)
member.summary: Reads all quantization table parameters.

member.summary: Writes all quantization table parameters.

member.name: P:Telerik.WinForms.Documents.Core.Imaging.Jpeg.Tables.ScanHeader.BitPositionHigh
member.summary: Gets Successive approximation bit position high.
member.remarks: CCITT T.81, Annex B, section B.2.3 Scan header syntax (see Ah parameter in the Table B.3). This parameter specifies the point transform used in the preceding scan (i.e. successive approximation bit position low in the preceding scan) for the band of coefficients specified by Ss and Se. This parameter shall be set to zero for the first scan of each band of coefficients. In the lossless mode of operations this parameter has no meaning. It shall be set to zero.

member.name: P:Telerik.WinForms.Documents.Core.Imaging.Jpeg.Tables.ScanHeader.BitPositionLow
member.summary: Gets Successive approximation bit position low or point transform.
member.remarks: CCITT T.81, Annex B, section B.2.3 Scan header syntax (see Al parameter in the Table B.3). In the DCT modes of operation this parameter specifies the point transform, i.e. bit position low, used before coding the band of coefficients specified by Ss and Se. This parameter shall be set to zero for the sequential DCT processes. In the lossless mode of operations, this parameter specifies the point transform, Pt.

member.name: P:Telerik.WinForms.Documents.Core.Imaging.Jpeg.Tables.ScanHeader.Length
member.summary: Gets a scan header length.
member.remarks: CCITT T.81, Annex B, section B.2.3 Scan header syntax (see Ls parameter in the Table B.3).

member.name: P:Telerik.WinForms.Documents.Core.Imaging.Jpeg.Tables.ScanHeader.SpectralSelectionEnd
member.summary: Gets End of spectral selection.
member.remarks: CCITT T.81, Annex B, section B.2.3 Scan header syntax (see Se parameter in the Table B.3). Specifies the last DCT coefficient in each block in zig-zag order which shall be coded in the scan. This parameter shall be set to 63 for the sequential DCT processes. In the lossless mode of operations this parameter has no meaning. It shall be set to zero.

member.name: P:Telerik.WinForms.Documents.Core.Imaging.Jpeg.Tables.ScanHeader.SpectralSelectionStart
member.summary: Gets Start of spectral or predictor selection.
member.remarks: CCITT T.81, Annex B, section B.2.3 Scan header syntax (see Ss parameter in the Table B.3). In the DCT modes of operation, this parameter specifies the first DCT coefficient in each block in zig-zag order which shall be coded in the scan. This parameter shall be set to zero for the sequential DCT processes. In the lossless mode of operations this parameter is used to select the predictor.

member.name: T:Telerik.WinForms.Documents.DrawingML.AlphaColorTransform
member.summary: Specifies its input color with the specific opacity, but with its color unchanged.

member.name: T:Telerik.WinForms.Documents.DrawingML.AlphaModulationColorTransform
member.summary: Specifies a more or less opaque version of its input color. An alpha modulate never increases the alpha beyond 100%. A 200% alpha modulate makes an input color twice as opaque as before. A 50% alpha modulate makes an input color half as opaque as before.

member.name: T:Telerik.WinForms.Documents.DrawingML.AlphaOffsetColorTransform
member.summary: Specifies a more or less opaque version of its input color. Increases or decreases the input alpha percentage by the specified percentage offset.A 10% alpha offset increases a 50% opacity to 60%. A -10% alpha offset decreases a 50% opacity to 40%. The transformed alpha values are limited to a range of 0 to 100%. A 10% alpha offset increase to a 100% opaque object still results in 100% opacity.

member.name: T:Telerik.WinForms.Documents.DrawingML.BlueColorTransform
member.summary: Specifies the input color with the specific blue component, but with the red and green color components unchanged.

member.name: T:Telerik.WinForms.Documents.DrawingML.BlueModulationColorTransform
member.summary: Specifies the input color with its blue component modulated by the given percentage. A 50% blue modulate will reduce the blue component by half. A 200% blue modulate will double the blue component.

member.name: T:Telerik.WinForms.Documents.DrawingML.BlueOffsetColorTransform
member.summary: Specifies the input color with its blue component shifted, but with its red and green color components unchanged.

member.name: T:Telerik.WinForms.Documents.DrawingML.ComplementColorTransform
member.summary: Specifies that the color rendered should be the complement of its input color with the complement being defined as such. Two colors are called complementary if, when mixed they produce a shade of gray.
member.example: The complement of red which is RGB (255, 0, 0) is cyan which is RGB (0, 255, 255).

member.name: T:Telerik.WinForms.Documents.DrawingML.GammaColorTransform
member.summary: Specifies that the output color rendered by the generating application should be the sRGB gamma shift of the input color.

member.name: T:Telerik.WinForms.Documents.DrawingML.GrayscaleColorTransform
member.summary: Specifies a grayscale of its input color, taking into relative intensities of the red, green, and blue primaries.

member.name: T:Telerik.WinForms.Documents.DrawingML.GreenColorTransform
member.summary: Specifies the input color with the specific green component, but with the blue and red color components unchanged.

member.name: T:Telerik.WinForms.Documents.DrawingML.GreenModulationColorTransform
member.summary: Specifies the input color with its green component modulated by the given percentage. A 50% green modulate will reduce the green component by half. A 200% green modulate will double the green component.

member.name: T:Telerik.WinForms.Documents.DrawingML.GreenOffsetColorTransform
member.summary: Specifies the input color with its green component shifted, but with its blue and red color components unchanged.

member.name: T:Telerik.WinForms.Documents.DrawingML.HueColorTransform
member.summary: Specifies specifies the input color with the specified hue, but with its saturation and luminance unchanged.

member.name: P:Telerik.WinForms.Documents.DrawingML.HueColorTransform.Hue
member.summary: Gets or sets the actual angle value to be used with the input color's hue component.
member.remarks: Only values in [0, 21600000) are accepted. Values out of bounds are coerced.

member.name: T:Telerik.WinForms.Documents.DrawingML.HueModulationColorTransform
member.summary: Specifies the input color with its hue modulated by the given percentage. A 50% hue modulate decreases the angular hue value by half. A 200% hue modulate doubles the angular hue value.

member.name: T:Telerik.WinForms.Documents.DrawingML.HueOffsetColorTransform
member.summary: Specifies the input color with its hue shifted, but with its saturation and luminance unchanged.

member.name: T:Telerik.WinForms.Documents.DrawingML.IColorTransform
member.summary: Specifies a color transform that is applied on an input color to produce a new color, without modifying the original one.

member.name: T:Telerik.WinForms.Documents.DrawingML.InverseColorTransform
member.summary: Specifies the inverse of its input color.
member.example: The inverse of red (1, 0, 0) is cyan (0, 1, 1 ).

member.name: T:Telerik.WinForms.Documents.DrawingML.InverseGammaColorTransform
member.summary: Specifies that the output color rendered by the generating application should be the inverse sRGB gamma shift of the input color.

member.name: T:Telerik.WinForms.Documents.DrawingML.IValueColorTransform
member.summary: Specifies a color transform that transforms an integer value.

member.name: P:Telerik.WinForms.Documents.DrawingML.IValueColorTransform.Value
member.summary: Gets or sets the value.

member.name: T:Telerik.WinForms.Documents.DrawingML.LuminanceColorTransform
member.summary: Specifies the input color with the specified luminance, but with its hue and saturation unchanged.

member.name: T:Telerik.WinForms.Documents.DrawingML.LuminanceModulationColorTransform
member.summary: Specifies specifies the input color with its luminance modulated by the given percentage. A 50% luminance modulate will reduce the luminance by half. A 200% luminance modulate will double the luminance.

member.name: T:Telerik.WinForms.Documents.DrawingML.LuminanceOffsetColorTransform
member.summary: Specifies the input color with its luminance shifted, but with its saturation and hue unchanged.

member.name: T:Telerik.WinForms.Documents.DrawingML.RedColorTransform
member.summary: Specifies the input color with the specific red component, but with the blue and green color components unchanged.

member.name: T:Telerik.WinForms.Documents.DrawingML.RedModulationColorTransform
member.summary: Specifies the input color with its red component modulated by the given percentage. A 50% red modulate will reduce the red component by half. A 200% red modulate will double the red component.

member.name: T:Telerik.WinForms.Documents.DrawingML.RedOffsetColorTransform
member.summary: Specifies the input color with its red component shifted, but with its blue and green color components unchanged.

member.name: T:Telerik.WinForms.Documents.DrawingML.SaturationColorTransform
member.summary: Specifies specifies the input color with the specified saturation, but with its hue and luminance unchanged.

member.name: T:Telerik.WinForms.Documents.DrawingML.SaturationModulationColorTransform
member.summary: Specifies the input color with its saturation modulated by the given percentage. A 50% hue modulate decreases the angular saturation value by half. A 200% hue modulate doubles the angular saturation value.

member.name: T:Telerik.WinForms.Documents.DrawingML.SaturationOffsetColorTransform
member.summary: Specifies the input color with its saturation shifted, but with its hue and luminance unchanged.

member.name: T:Telerik.WinForms.Documents.DrawingML.ShadeColorTransform
member.summary: Specifies a darker version of its input color.
member.example: A 10% tint is 10% of the input color combined with 90% black.

member.name: T:Telerik.WinForms.Documents.DrawingML.TintColorTransform
member.summary: Specifies a lighter version of its input color.
member.example: A 10% tint is 10% of the input color combined with 90% white.

member.name: T:Telerik.WinForms.Documents.DrawingML.ValueColorTransform
member.summary: Specifies a color transform that affects a single value.

member.name: P:Telerik.WinForms.Documents.DrawingML.ValueColorTransform.Value
member.summary: Gets or sets the percentage value.
member.remarks: Only values in [0, 100000] are accepted. Values out of bounds are coerced.

member.name: T:Telerik.WinForms.Documents.DrawingML.ValueModulationColorTransform
member.summary: Specifies a color transform. A modulation will never increases the original value beyond 100%. A 200% modulate doubles the original value, while a 50% modulate takses only half of it.

member.name: P:Telerik.WinForms.Documents.DrawingML.ValueModulationColorTransform.Value
member.summary: Gets or sets the modulation value.
member.remarks: Only values in [0, ∞) are accepted. Values out of bounds are coerced.

member.name: T:Telerik.WinForms.Documents.DrawingML.ValueOffsetColorTransform
member.summary: Specifies an absolute value that is added to the original value. The shifted values are limited to a range of 0 to 100%.

member.name: P:Telerik.WinForms.Documents.DrawingML.ValueOffsetColorTransform.Value
member.summary: Gets or sets the offset value.
member.remarks: Only values in [-100000, 100000] are accepted. Values out of bounds are coerced.

member.name: P:Telerik.WinForms.Documents.DrawingML.DrawingColor.ColorTransforms
member.summary: Gets the list of color transforms that are applied to the current color.

member.name: P:Telerik.WinForms.Documents.DrawingML.HslColor.Hue
member.summary: Gets or sets the angular value describing the wavelength.
member.remarks: Only values in [0, 21600000) are accepted. Values out of bounds are coerced.

member.name: P:Telerik.WinForms.Documents.DrawingML.HslColor.Luminance
member.summary: Gets or sets the luminance referring to the lightness or darkness of the color. Expressed as a percentage with 0% referring to maximal dark(black) and 100% referring to maximal white.
member.remarks: Only values in [0, 100000] are accepted. Values out of bounds are coerced.

member.name: P:Telerik.WinForms.Documents.DrawingML.HslColor.Saturation
member.summary: Gets or sets the saturation referring to the purity of the hue. Expressed as a percentage with 0% referring to grey, 100% referring to the purest form of the hue.
member.remarks: Only values in [0, 100000] are accepted. Values out of bounds are coerced.

member.name: T:Telerik.WinForms.Documents.DrawingML.PresetColor
member.summary: Specifies a color which is bound to one of a predefined collection of colors.

member.name: P:Telerik.WinForms.Documents.DrawingML.PresetColor.Value
member.summary: Gets or sets the actual preset color value.

member.name: T:Telerik.WinForms.Documents.DrawingML.RgbColor
member.summary: Specifies a color using the red, green, blue RGB color model. Each component, red, green, and blue is expressed as a byte value. A perceptual gamma of 2.2 is used.

member.name: F:Telerik.WinForms.Documents.DrawingML.RgbColor.Red
member.summary: Gets or sets the red value.

member.name: F:Telerik.WinForms.Documents.DrawingML.RgbColor.Green
member.summary: Gets or sets the red value.

member.name: F:Telerik.WinForms.Documents.DrawingML.RgbColor.Blue
member.summary: Gets or sets the red value.

member.name: T:Telerik.WinForms.Documents.DrawingML.RgbPercentColor
member.summary: Specifies a color using the red, green, blue RGB color model. Each component, red, green, and blue is expressed as a percentage from 0% to 100%. A linear gamma of 1.0 is assumed.

member.name: P:Telerik.WinForms.Documents.DrawingML.RgbPercentColor.Red
member.summary: Gets or sets the red value.
member.remarks: Only values in [0, 100000] are accepted. Values out of bounds are coerced.

member.name: P:Telerik.WinForms.Documents.DrawingML.RgbPercentColor.Green
member.summary: Gets or sets the gren value.
member.remarks: Only values in [0, 100000] are accepted. Values out of bounds are coerced.

member.name: P:Telerik.WinForms.Documents.DrawingML.RgbPercentColor.Blue
member.summary: Gets or sets the blue value.
member.remarks: Only values in [0, 100000] are accepted. Values out of bounds are coerced.

member.name: T:Telerik.WinForms.Documents.DrawingML.SchemeColor
member.summary: Specifies a color bound to a user's theme. As with all elements which define a color, it is possible to apply a list of color transforms to the base color defined.

member.name: P:Telerik.WinForms.Documents.DrawingML.SchemeColor.Value
member.summary: Gets or sets the desired scheme value.

member.name: T:Telerik.WinForms.Documents.DrawingML.SystemColor
member.summary: Specifies a system color value. This color is based upon the value that this color currently has within the system on which the document is being viewed.

member.name: P:Telerik.WinForms.Documents.DrawingML.SystemColor.LastColor
member.summary: Gets or sets a fallback color that should be used if the uderlying SystemColor is unknown within the system. It is also the color value that was last computed by the generating application.

member.name: P:Telerik.WinForms.Documents.DrawingML.SystemColor.Value
member.summary: Gets or sets the system color value.

member.name: T:Telerik.WinForms.Documents.DrawingML.AlphaBiLevelEffect
member.summary: Represents an Alpha Bi-Level Effect. Alpha(Opacity) values less than the threshold are changed to 0 (fully transparent) and alpha values greater than or equal to the threshold are changed to 100% (fully opaque).

member.name: P:Telerik.WinForms.Documents.DrawingML.AlphaBiLevelEffect.Threshold
member.summary: Gets or sets the threshold value for the alpha bi-level effect.
member.remarks: Only positive percent values are accepted. Values out of bounds are coerced.

member.name: T:Telerik.WinForms.Documents.DrawingML.AlphaCeilingEffect
member.summary: Represents an alpha ceiling effect. Alpha(opacity) values greater than zero are changed to 100%. In other words, anything partially opaque becomes fully opaque.

member.name: T:Telerik.WinForms.Documents.DrawingML.AlphaFloorEffect
member.summary: Represents an alpha floor effect. Alpha(opacity) values less than 100% are changed to zero. In other words, anything partially transparent becomes fully transparent.

member.name: T:Telerik.WinForms.Documents.DrawingML.AlphaInsetOutsetEffect
member.summary: Represents an alpha outset/inset effect. This is equivalent to an alpha ceiling, followed by alpha blur, followed by either an alpha ceiling(positive radius) or alpha floor(negative radius).

member.name: P:Telerik.WinForms.Documents.DrawingML.AlphaInsetOutsetEffect.Radius
member.summary: Gets or sets the radius of outset/inset.

member.name: T:Telerik.WinForms.Documents.DrawingML.AlphaInverseEffect
member.summary: Represents an alpha inverse effect. Alpha(opacity) values are inverted by subtracting from 100%.

member.name: P:Telerik.WinForms.Documents.DrawingML.AlphaInverseEffect.EffectColor
member.summary: Gets or sets the color that would be affected by the effect.

member.name: T:Telerik.WinForms.Documents.DrawingML.AlphaModulateEffect
member.summary: Represents an alpha modulate effect. Effect alpha(opacity) values are multiplied by a fixed percentage. The effect container specifies an effect containing alpha values to modulate.

member.name: P:Telerik.WinForms.Documents.DrawingML.AlphaModulateEffect.Container
member.summary: Gets the effect container.

member.name: T:Telerik.WinForms.Documents.DrawingML.AlphaModulateFixedEffect
member.summary: Represents an alpha modulate fixed effect. Effect alpha(opacity) values are multiplied by a fixed percentage.

member.name: P:Telerik.WinForms.Documents.DrawingML.AlphaModulateFixedEffect.Amount
member.summary: Gets or sets the percentage amount to scale the alpha.
member.remarks: Only positive percent values are accepted. Values out of bounds are coerced.

member.name: T:Telerik.WinForms.Documents.DrawingML.AlphaReplceEffect
member.summary: Represents an alpha replace effect. Effect alpha(opacity) values are replaced by a fixed alpha.

member.name: P:Telerik.WinForms.Documents.DrawingML.AlphaReplceEffect.Alpha
member.summary: Gets or sets the new opacity value.
member.remarks: Only values in [0, 100000] are accepted. Values out of bounds are coerced.

member.name: T:Telerik.WinForms.Documents.DrawingML.BiLevelEffect
member.summary: Represents a bi-level (black/white) effect. Input colors whose luminance is less than the specified threshold value are changed to black. Input colors whose luminance are greater than or equal the specified value are set to white.

member.name: P:Telerik.WinForms.Documents.DrawingML.BiLevelEffect.Threshold
member.summary: Gets or sets luminance threshold for the Bi-Level effect. Values greater than or equal to the threshold are set to white.Values lesser than the threshold are set to black.
member.remarks: Only positive percent values are accepted. Values out of bounds are coerced.
Only values in [0, 100000] are accepted. Values out of bounds are coerced.

member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates how to blend the effects.

member.name: P:Telerik.WinForms.Documents.DrawingML.BlendEffect.Effects
member.summary: Gets or sets the effects to blend.

member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the bounds of the object should be grown as a result of the blurring.

member.summary: Gets or sets the radius of blur.

member.name: P:Telerik.WinForms.Documents.DrawingML.ColorChangeEffect.ChangeColorTo

member.summary: Gets or sets the color that would be affected by the effect.

member.summary: Represents a duotone effect. For each pixel, combines clr1 and clr2 through a linear interpolation to determine the new color for that pixel.

member.summary: Gets or sets the color that would be affected by the effect.

member.summary: Gets or sets the reference. Its value may be the name of an effect container, or one of four special references: 'fill'; 'line', 'fillLine', 'children'

member.name: T:Telerik.WinForms.Documents.DrawingML.GrayScaleEffect
member.summary: Specifies a gray scale effect. Converts all effect color values to a shade of gray, corresponding to their luminance. Effect alpha (opacity) values are unaffected.

member.summary: Specifies a hue/saturation/luminance effect. The hue, saturation, and luminance may each be adjusted relative to its current value.

member.summary: Gets or sets the angular value describing the wavelength.

member.name: T:Telerik.WinForms.Documents.DrawingML.TransformEffect
member.summary: Specifies a transform effect. The transform is applied to each point in the shape's geometry.

member.name: P:Telerik.WinForms.Documents.DrawingML.TransformEffect.VerticalRatio
member.summary: Gets or sets percentage by which to vertically scale the object.

member.name: P:Telerik.WinForms.Documents.DrawingML.TransformEffect.HorizontalRatio
member.summary: Gets or sets percentage by which to horizontally scale the object.

member.name: P:Telerik.WinForms.Documents.DrawingML.TransformEffect.HorizontalSkew
member.summary: Gets or sets the horizontal skew angle, defined as the agnle between the top-left corner and bottom-left corner of the object's original bounding box. If positive, the bottom edge of the shape will be positioned to the right relative to the top edge.
member.remarks: Only values in (-5400000, 5400000) are accepted. Values out of bounds are coerced.

member.name: P:Telerik.WinForms.Documents.DrawingML.TransformEffect.VerticalSkew
member.summary: Gets or sets the vertical skew angle, defined as the angle between the top-left corner and top-right corner of the object's original bounding box. If positive, the right edge of the object will be positioned lower relative to the left edge.
member.remarks: Only values in (-5400000, 5400000) are accepted. Values out of bounds are coerced.

member.name: P:Telerik.WinForms.Documents.DrawingML.TransformEffect.HorizontalShift
member.summary: Gets or sets the the horizontal shift.

member.name: P:Telerik.WinForms.Documents.DrawingML.TransformEffect.VerticalShift
member.summary: Gets or sets the the vertical shift.

member.name: T:Telerik.WinForms.Documents.DrawingML.GradientFill
member.summary: Specifies a gradient fill - smooth transition between a set of given colors.

member.name: P:Telerik.WinForms.Documents.DrawingML.GradientFill.TileRectangle
member.summary: Gets or sets a rectangular region of the shape to which the gradient is applied. This region is then tiled across the remaining area of the shape to complete the fill. The tile rectangle is defined by percentage offsets from the sides of the shape's bounding box.

member.name: P:Telerik.WinForms.Documents.DrawingML.GradientFill.Gradient
member.summary: Gets or sets the gradient.

member.name: P:Telerik.WinForms.Documents.DrawingML.GradientFill.GradientStops
member.summary: Gets the collection of gradient stops.

member.name: P:Telerik.WinForms.Documents.DrawingML.GradientFill.RotateWithShape
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the fill rotates alongside the shape when it is rotated.

member.name: T:Telerik.WinForms.Documents.DrawingML.TextWrappingType
member.summary: Specifies the text wrapping types.

member.name: F:Telerik.WinForms.Documents.DrawingML.TextWrappingType.None
member.summary: No wrapping will occur on this text body. Words will spill out without paying attention to the bounding rectangle boundaries.

member.name: F:Telerik.WinForms.Documents.DrawingML.TextWrappingType.Square
member.summary: Determines if words are wrapped within the bounding rectangle of the parent DrawingML object.

member.name: T:Telerik.WinForms.Documents.DrawingML.VerticalOverflowType
member.summary: Specifies the text vertical overflow types.

member.name: F:Telerik.WinForms.Documents.DrawingML.VerticalOverflowType.Overflow
member.summary: Overflow the text and pay no attention to top and bottom barriers.

member.name: F:Telerik.WinForms.Documents.DrawingML.VerticalOverflowType.Ellipsis
member.summary: Pay attention to top and bottom barriers. Use an ellipsis to denote that there is text which is not visible.

member.name: F:Telerik.WinForms.Documents.DrawingML.VerticalOverflowType.Clip
member.summary: Pay attention to top and bottom barriers. Provide no indication that there is text which is not visible.

member.name: T:Telerik.WinForms.Documents.DrawingML.VerticalTextType
member.summary: Specifies the types of vertical text.

member.name: F:Telerik.WinForms.Documents.DrawingML.VerticalTextType.Horizontal
member.summary: Horizontal text.

member.name: F:Telerik.WinForms.Documents.DrawingML.VerticalTextType.Vertical
member.summary: Determines if all of the text is vertical orientation (each line is 90 degrees rotated clockwise, so it goes from top to bottom; each next line is to the left from the previous one).

member.name: F:Telerik.WinForms.Documents.DrawingML.VerticalTextType.Vertical270
member.summary: Determines if all of the text is vertical orientation (each line is 270 degrees rotated clockwise, so it goes from bottom to top; each next line is to the right from the previous one).

member.name: F:Telerik.WinForms.Documents.DrawingML.VerticalTextType.WordArtVertical
member.summary: Determines if all of the text is vertical ("one letter on top of another").

member.name: F:Telerik.WinForms.Documents.DrawingML.VerticalTextType.EastAsianVertical
member.summary: A special version of vertical text, where some fonts are displayed as if rotated by 90 degrees while some fonts (mostly East Asian) are displayed vertical.

member.name: F:Telerik.WinForms.Documents.DrawingML.VerticalTextType.MongolianVertical
member.summary: A special version of vertical text, where some fonts are displayed as if rotated by 90 degrees while some fonts (mostly East Asian) are displayed vertical. The difference between this and the EastAsianVertical is the text flows top down then LEFT to RIGHT, instead of RIGHT to LEFT.

member.name: F:Telerik.WinForms.Documents.DrawingML.VerticalTextType.WordArtVerticalRightToLeft

member.name: T:Telerik.WinForms.Documents.FormatProviders.Html.Parsing.Dom.DomException
member.summary:
DOM operations only raise exceptions in "exceptional" circumstances, i.e., when an operation is impossible to perform (either for logical reasons, because data is lost, or because the implementation has become unstable). In general, DOM methods return specific error values in ordinary processing situations, such as out-of-bound errors when using NodeList.
Implementations should raise other exceptions under other circumstances. For example, implementations should raise an implementation-dependent exception if a null argument is passed.
Some languages and object systems do not support the concept of exceptions. For such systems, error conditions may be indicated using native error reporting mechanisms. For some bindings, for example, methods may return error codes similar to those listed in the corresponding method descriptions.
See also the Document Object Model (DOM) Level 2 Core Specification.

member.summary: If the specified range of text does not fit into a DOMString

member.summary: If any node is inserted somewhere it doesn't belong

member.summary: If a node is used in a different document than the one that created it (that doesn't support it)

member.summary: If an invalid or illegal character is specified, such as in a name. See production 2 in the XML specification for the definition of a legal character, and production 5 for the definition of a legal name character.

member.name: T:Telerik.WinForms.Documents.FormatProviders.Html.Parsing.Dom.IAttr
member.summary:
The Attr interface represents an attribute in an Element object. Typically the allowable values for the attribute are defined in a document type definition.
Attr objects inherit the Node interface, but since they are not actually child nodes of the element they describe, the DOM does not consider them part of the document tree. Thus, the Node attributes parentNode, previousSibling, and nextSibling have a null value for Attr objects. The DOM takes the view that attributes are properties of elements rather than having a separate identity from the elements they are associated with; this should make it more efficient to implement such features as default attributes associated with all elements of a given type. Furthermore, Attr nodes may not be immediate children of a DocumentFragment. However, they can be associated with Element nodes contained within a DocumentFragment. In short, users and implementors of the DOM need to be aware that Attr nodes have some things in common with other objects inheriting the Node interface, but they also are quite distinct.
The attribute's effective value is determined as follows: if this attribute has been explicitly assigned any value, that value is the attribute's effective value; otherwise, if there is a declaration for this attribute, and that declaration includes a default value, then that default value is the attribute's effective value; otherwise, the attribute does not exist on this element in the structure model until it has been explicitly added. Note that the nodeValue attribute on the Attr instance can also be used to retrieve the string version of the attribute's value(s).
In XML, where the value of an attribute can contain entity references, the child nodes of the Attr node may be either Text or EntityReference nodes (when these are in use; see the description of EntityReference for discussion). Because the DOM Core is not aware of attribute types, it treats all attribute values as simple strings, even if the DTD or schema declares them as having tokenized types.
See also the Document Object Model (DOM) Level 2 Core Specification.

member.name: P:Telerik.WinForms.Documents.FormatProviders.Html.Parsing.Dom.IAttr.Name
member.summary: Returns the name of this attribute.

member.name: P:Telerik.WinForms.Documents.FormatProviders.Html.Parsing.Dom.IAttr.Specified
member.summary:
If this attribute was explicitly given a value in the original document, this is true; otherwise, it is false. Note that the implementation is in charge of this attribute, not the user. If the user changes the value of the attribute (even if it ends up having the same value as the default value) then the specified flag is automatically flipped to true. To re-specify the attribute as the default value from the DTD, the user must delete the attribute. The implementation will then make a new attribute available with specified set to false and the default value (if one exists).
In summary: If the attribute has an assigned value in the document then specified is true, and the value is the assigned value. If the attribute has no assigned value in the document and has a default value in the DTD, then specified is false, and the value is the default value in the DTD. If the attribute has no assigned value in the document and has a value of #IMPLIED in the DTD, then the attribute does not appear in the structure model of the document. If the ownerElement attribute is null (i.e. because it was just created or was set to null by the various removal and cloning operations) specified is true.

member.name: P:Telerik.WinForms.Documents.FormatProviders.Html.Parsing.Dom.IAttr.Value
member.summary:
On retrieval, the value of the attribute is returned as a string. Character and general entity references are replaced with their values. See also the method getAttribute on the Element interface.
On setting, this creates a Text node with the unparsed contents of the string. I.e. any characters that an XML processor would recognize as markup are instead treated as literal text. See also the method setAttribute on the Element interface.
member.exception: NO_MODIFICATION_ALLOWED_ERR: Raised when the node is readonly.

member.name: P:Telerik.WinForms.Documents.FormatProviders.Html.Parsing.Dom.IAttr.OwnerElement
member.summary: The Element node this attribute is attached to or null if this attribute is not in use.

member.name: T:Telerik.WinForms.Documents.FormatProviders.Html.Parsing.Dom.ICdataSection
member.summary:
CDATA sections are used to escape blocks of text containing characters that would otherwise be regarded as markup. The only delimiter that is recognized in a CDATA section is the "]]>" string that ends the CDATA section. CDATA sections cannot be nested. Their primary purpose is for including material such as XML fragments, without needing to escape all the delimiters.
The DOMString attribute of the Text node holds the text that is contained by the CDATA section. Note that this may contain characters that need to be escaped outside of CDATA sections and that, depending on the character encoding ("charset") chosen for serialization, it may be impossible to write out some characters as part of a CDATA section.
The CDATASection interface inherits from the CharacterData interface through the Text interface. Adjacent CDATASection nodes are not merged by use of the normalize method of the Node interface. Because no markup is recognized within a CDATASection, character numeric references cannot be used as an escape mechanism when serializing. Therefore, action needs to be taken when serializing a CDATASection with a character encoding where some of the contained characters cannot be represented. Failure to do so would not produce well-formed XML.One potential solution in the serialization process is to end the CDATA section before the character, output the character using a character reference or entity reference, and open a new CDATA section for any further characters in the text node. Note, however, that some code conversion libraries at the time of writing do not return an error or exception when a character is missing from the encoding, making the task of ensuring that data is not corrupted on serialization more difficult.
See also the Document Object Model (DOM) Level 2 Core Specification.

member.name: T:Telerik.WinForms.Documents.FormatProviders.Html.Parsing.Dom.ICharacterData
member.summary:
The CharacterData interface extends Node with a set of attributes and methods for accessing character data in the DOM. For clarity this set is defined here rather than on each object that uses these attributes and methods. No DOM objects correspond directly to CharacterData, though Text and others do inherit the interface from it. All offsets in this interface start from 0.
As explained in the DOMString interface, text strings in the DOM are represented in UTF-16, i.e. as a sequence of 16-bit units. In the following, the term 16-bit units is used whenever necessary to indicate that indexing on CharacterData is done in 16-bit units.
See also the Document Object Model (DOM) Level 2 Core Specification.

member.name: P:Telerik.WinForms.Documents.FormatProviders.Html.Parsing.Dom.ICharacterData.Data
member.summary: The character data of the node that implements this interface. The DOM implementation may not put arbitrary limits on the amount of data that may be stored in a CharacterData node. However, implementation limits may mean that the entirety of a node's data may not fit into a single DOMString. In such cases, the user may call substringData to retrieve the data in appropriately sized pieces.
member.exception: NO_MODIFICATION_ALLOWED_ERR: Raised when the node is readonly.
DOMSTRING_SIZE_ERR: Raised when it would return more characters than fit in a DOMString variable on the implementation platform.

member.name: P:Telerik.WinForms.Documents.FormatProviders.Html.Parsing.Dom.ICharacterData.Length
member.summary: The number of 16-bit units that are available through data and the substringData method below. This may have the value zero, i.e., CharacterData nodes may be empty.

member.name: M:Telerik.WinForms.Documents.FormatProviders.Html.Parsing.Dom.ICharacterData.SubstringData(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Extracts a range of data from the node.
member.param: Start offset of substring to extract.
The number of 16-bit units to extract.
member.returns: The specified substring. If the sum of offset and count exceeds the length, then all 16-bit units to the end of the data are returned.
member.exception:
INDEX_SIZE_ERR: Raised if the specified offset is negative or greater than the number of 16-bit units in data, or if the specified count is negative.
DOMSTRING_SIZE_ERR: Raised if the specified range of text does not fit into a DOMString.

member.name: M:Telerik.WinForms.Documents.FormatProviders.Html.Parsing.Dom.ICharacterData.AppendData(System.String)
member.summary: Append the string to the end of the character data of the node. Upon success, data provides access to the concatenation of data and the DOMString specified.
member.exception: NO_MODIFICATION_ALLOWED_ERR: Raised if this node is readonly.

member.name: M:Telerik.WinForms.Documents.FormatProviders.Html.Parsing.Dom.ICharacterData.InsertData(System.Int32,System.String)
member.summary: Insert a string at the specified 16-bit unit offset.

member.exception:
INDEX_SIZE_ERR: Raised if the specified offset is negative or greater than the number of 16-bit units in data.
NO_MODIFICATION_ALLOWED_ERR: Raised if this node is readonly.

member.name: M:Telerik.WinForms.Documents.FormatProviders.Html.Parsing.Dom.ICharacterData.DeleteData(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Remove a range of 16-bit units from the node. Upon success, data and length reflect the change.
member.param: The offset from which to start removing.
The number of 16-bit units to delete. If the sum of offset and count exceeds length then all 16-bit units from offset to the end of the data are deleted.
member.exception:

NO_MODIFICATION_ALLOWED_ERR: Raised if this node is readonly.

member.name: M:Telerik.WinForms.Documents.FormatProviders.Html.Parsing.Dom.ICharacterData.ReplaceData(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.String)
member.summary: Replace the characters starting at the specified 16-bit unit offset with the specified string.
member.param: The offset from which to start replacing.

The number of 16-bit units to replace. If the sum of offset and count exceeds length, then all 16-bit units to the end of the data are replaced; (i.e., the effect is the same as a remove method call with the same range, followed by an append method invocation).
The DOMString with which the range must be replaced.
member.exception:
INDEX_SIZE_ERR: Raised if the specified offset is negative or greater than the number of 16-bit units in data, or if the specified count is negative.
NO_MODIFICATION_ALLOWED_ERR: Raised if this node is readonly.

member.name: T:Telerik.WinForms.Documents.FormatProviders.Html.Parsing.Dom.IComment
member.summary:
This interface inherits from CharacterData and represents the content of a comment, i.e., all the characters between the starting ' <!--' and ending '-->'. Note that this is the definition of a comment in XML, and, in practice, HTML, although some HTML tools may implement the full SGML comment structure.
See also the Document Object Model (DOM) Level 2 Core Specification.

member.name: T:Telerik.WinForms.Documents.FormatProviders.Html.Parsing.Dom.IDocument
member.summary:
The Document interface represents the entire HTML or XML document. Conceptually, it is the root of the document tree, and provides the primary access to the document's data.
Since elements, text nodes, comments, processing instructions, etc. cannot exist outside the context of a Document, the Document interface also contains the factory methods needed to create these objects. The Node objects created have a ownerDocument attribute which associates them with the Document within whose context they were created.
See also the Document Object Model (DOM) Level 2 Core Specification.

member.name: P:Telerik.WinForms.Documents.FormatProviders.Html.Parsing.Dom.IDocument.Doctype
member.summary: The Document Type Declaration (see DocumentType) associated with this document. For HTML documents as well as XML documents without a document type declaration this returns null. The DOM Level 2 does not support editing the Document Type Declaration. docType cannot be altered in any way, including through the use of methods inherited from the Node interface, such as insertNode or removeNode.

member.name: P:Telerik.WinForms.Documents.FormatProviders.Html.Parsing.Dom.IDocument.Implementation
member.summary: The DOMImplementation object that handles this document. A DOM application may use objects from multiple implementations.

member.name: P:Telerik.WinForms.Documents.FormatProviders.Html.Parsing.Dom.IDocument.DocumentElement
member.summary: This is a convenience attribute that allows direct access to the child node that is the root element of the document. For HTML documents, this is the element with the tagName "HTML".

member.name: M:Telerik.WinForms.Documents.FormatProviders.Html.Parsing.Dom.IDocument.CreateElement(System.String)
member.summary:
Creates an element of the type specified. Note that the instance returned implements the Element interface, so attributes can be specified directly on the returned object.
In addition, if there are known attributes with default values, Attr nodes representing them are automatically created and attached to the element.
To create an element with a qualified name and namespace URI, use the createElementNS method.
member.param: The name of the element type to instantiate. For XML, this is case-sensitive. For HTML, the tagName parameter may be provided in any case, but it must be mapped to the canonical uppercase form by the DOM implementation.
member.returns: A new Element object with the nodeName attribute set to tagName, and localName, prefix, and namespaceURI set to null.
member.exception: INVALID_CHARACTER_ERR: Raised if the specified name contains an illegal character.

member.summary: Creates an EntityReference object. In addition, if the referenced entity is known, the child list of the EntityReference node is made the same as that of the corresponding Entity node.If any descendant of the Entity node has an unbound namespace prefix, the corresponding descendant of the created EntityReference node is also unbound; (its namespaceURI is null). The DOM Level 2 does not support any mechanism to resolve namespace prefixes.
member.param: The name of the entity to reference.
member.returns: The new EntityReference object.
member.exception:
INVALID_CHARACTER_ERR: Raised if the specified name contains an illegal character.

member.summary: Returns a NodeList of all the Elements with a given tag name in the order in which they are encountered in a preorder traversal of the Document tree.
member.param: The name of the tag to match on. The special value "*" matches all tags.
member.returns: A new NodeList object containing all the matched Elements.

member.name: M:Telerik.WinForms.Documents.FormatProviders.Html.Parsing.Dom.IDocument.ImportNode(Telerik.WinForms.Documents.FormatProviders.Html.Parsing.Dom.INode,System.Boolean)
member.summary:
Imports a node from another document to this document. The returned node has no parent; (parentNode is null). The source node is not altered or removed from the original document; this method creates a new copy of the source node.
For all nodes, importing a node creates a node object owned by the importing document, with attribute values identical to the source node's nodeName and nodeType, plus the attributes related to namespaces (prefix, localName, and namespaceURI). As in the cloneNode operation on a Node, the source node is not altered.
Additional information is copied as appropriate to the nodeType, attempting to mirror the behavior expected if a fragment of XML or HTML source was copied from one document to another, recognizing that the two documents may have different DTDs in the XML case. The following list describes the specifics for each type of node.
ATTRIBUTE_NODE The ownerElement attribute is set to null and the specified flag is set to true on the generated Attr. The descendants of the source Attr are recursively imported and the resulting nodes reassembled to form the corresponding subtree. Note that the deep parameter has no effect on Attr nodes; they always carry their children with them when imported. DOCUMENT_FRAGMENT_NODE If the deep option was set to true, the descendants of the source element are recursively imported and the resulting nodes reassembled to form the corresponding subtree. Otherwise, this simply generates an empty DocumentFragment. DOCUMENT_NODE Document nodes cannot be imported. DOCUMENT_TYPE_NODE DocumentType nodes cannot be imported. ELEMENT_NODE Specified attribute nodes of the source element are imported, and the generated Attr nodes are attached to the generated Element. Default attributes are not copied, though if the document being imported into defines default attributes for this element name, those are assigned. If the importNode deep parameter was set to true, the descendants of the source element are recursively imported and the resulting nodes reassembled to form the corresponding subtree. ENTITY_NODE Entity nodes can be imported, however in the current release of the DOM the DocumentType is readonly. Ability to add these imported nodes to a DocumentType will be considered for addition to a future release of the DOM.On import, the publicId, systemId, and notationName attributes are copied. If a deep import is requested, the descendants of the the source Entity are recursively imported and the resulting nodes reassembled to form the corresponding subtree.
ENTITY_REFERENCE_NODE Only the EntityReference itself is copied, even if a deep import is requested, since the source and destination documents might have defined the entity differently. If the document being imported into provides a definition for this entity name, its value is assigned. NOTATION_NODE
Notation nodes can be imported, however in the current release of the DOM the DocumentType is readonly. Ability to add these imported nodes to a DocumentType will be considered for addition to a future release of the DOM.On import, the publicId and systemId attributes are copied. Note that the deep parameter has no effect on Notation nodes since they never have any children.
PROCESSING_INSTRUCTION_NODE The imported node copies its target and data values from those of the source node. TEXT_NODE, CDATA_SECTION_NODE, COMMENT_NODE These three types of nodes inheriting from CharacterData copy their data and length attributes from those of the source node.
member.param: If true, recursively import the subtree under the specified node; if false, import only the node itself, as explained above. This has no effect on Attr , EntityReference, and Notation nodes.
member.returns: The imported node that belongs to this Document.
member.exception: NOT_SUPPORTED_ERR: Raised if the type of node being imported is not supported.

member.param: The namespace URI of the element to create.

member.exception:

NAMESPACE_ERR: Raised if the qualifiedName is malformed, if the qualifiedName has a prefix and the namespaceURI is null, or if the qualifiedName has a prefix that is "xml" and the namespaceURI is different from " http://www.w3.org/XML/1998/namespace" .

member.summary: Creates an attribute of the given qualified name and namespace URI. HTML-only DOM implementations do not need to implement this method.
member.param: The namespace URI of the attribute to create.
The qualified name of the attribute to instantiate.
member.returns: A new Attr object with the following attributes: AttributeValueNode.nodeNamequalifiedName Node.namespaceURInamespaceURI Node.prefixprefix, extracted from qualifiedName, or null if there is no prefixNode.localNamelocal name, extracted from qualifiedNameAttr.name qualifiedNameNode.nodeValuethe empty string
member.exception:
INVALID_CHARACTER_ERR: Raised if the specified qualified name contains an illegal character.
NAMESPACE_ERR: Raised if the qualifiedName is malformed, if the qualifiedName has a prefix and the namespaceURI is null, if the qualifiedName has a prefix that is "xml" and the namespaceURI is different from " http://www.w3.org/XML/1998/namespace", or if the qualifiedName is "xmlns" and the namespaceURI is different from " http://www.w3.org/2000/xmlns/".

The local name of the elements to match on. The special value "*" matches all local names.
member.returns: A new NodeList object containing all the matched Elements.

member.name: M:Telerik.WinForms.Documents.FormatProviders.Html.Parsing.Dom.IDocument.GetElementById(System.String)
member.summary: Returns the Element whose ID is given by elementId. If no such element exists, returns null. Behavior is not defined if more than one element has this ID. The DOM implementation must have information that says which attributes are of type ID. Attributes with the name "ID" are not of type ID unless so defined. Implementations that do not know whether attributes are of type ID or not are expected to return null.
member.param: The unique id value for an element.
member.returns: The matching element.

member.name: T:Telerik.WinForms.Documents.FormatProviders.Html.Parsing.Dom.IDocumentFragment
member.summary:
DocumentFragment is a "lightweight" or "minimal" Document object. It is very common to want to be able to extract a portion of a document's tree or to create a new fragment of a document. Imagine implementing a user command like cut or rearranging a document by moving fragments around. It is desirable to have an object which can hold such fragments and it is quite natural to use a Node for this purpose. While it is true that a Document object could fulfill this role, a Document object can potentially be a heavyweight object, depending on the underlying implementation. What is really needed for this is a very lightweight object. DocumentFragment is such an object.
Furthermore, various operations -- such as inserting nodes as children of another Node -- may take DocumentFragment objects as arguments; this results in all the child nodes of the DocumentFragment being moved to the child list of this node.
The children of a DocumentFragment node are zero or more nodes representing the tops of any sub-trees defining the structure of the document. DocumentFragment nodes do not need to be well-formed XML documents (although they do need to follow the rules imposed upon well-formed XML parsed entities, which can have multiple top nodes). For example, a DocumentFragment might have only one child and that child node could be a Text node. Such a structure model represents neither an HTML document nor a well-formed XML document.
When a DocumentFragment is inserted into a Document (or indeed any other Node that may take children) the children of the DocumentFragment and not the DocumentFragment itself are inserted into the Node. This makes the DocumentFragment very useful when the user wishes to create nodes that are siblings; the DocumentFragment acts as the parent of these nodes so that the user can use the standard methods from the Node interface, such as insertBefore and appendChild.
See also the Document Object Model (DOM) Level 2 Core Specification.

member.name: T:Telerik.WinForms.Documents.FormatProviders.Html.Parsing.Dom.IDocumentType
member.summary:
Each Document has a doctype attribute whose value is either null or a DocumentType object. The DocumentType interface in the DOM Core provides an interface to the list of entities that are defined for the document, and little else because the effect of namespaces and the various XML schema efforts on DTD representation are not clearly understood as of this writing.
The DOM Level 2 doesn't support editing DocumentType nodes.
See also the Document Object Model (DOM) Level 2 Core Specification.

member.name: P:Telerik.WinForms.Documents.FormatProviders.Html.Parsing.Dom.IDocumentType.Name
member.summary: The name of DTD; i.e., the name immediately following the DOCTYPE keyword.

member.name: P:Telerik.WinForms.Documents.FormatProviders.Html.Parsing.Dom.IDocumentType.Entities
member.summary:
A NamedNodeMap containing the general entities, both external and internal, declared in the DTD. Parameter entities are not contained. Duplicates are discarded. For example in: <!DOCTYPE ex SYSTEM "ex.dtd" [ <!ENTITY foo "foo"> <!ENTITY bar "bar"> <!ENTITY bar "bar2"> <!ENTITY % baz "baz"> ]> <ex/> the interface provides access to foo and the first declaration of bar but not the second declaration of bar or baz. Every node in this map also implements the Entity interface.
The DOM Level 2 does not support editing entities, therefore entities cannot be altered in any way.

member.name: P:Telerik.WinForms.Documents.FormatProviders.Html.Parsing.Dom.IDocumentType.Notations
member.summary:
A NamedNodeMap containing the notations declared in the DTD. Duplicates are discarded. Every node in this map also implements the Notation interface.
The DOM Level 2 does not support editing notations, therefore notations cannot be altered in any way.

member.name: P:Telerik.WinForms.Documents.FormatProviders.Html.Parsing.Dom.IDocumentType.PublicId
member.summary: The public identifier of the external subset.

member.name: P:Telerik.WinForms.Documents.FormatProviders.Html.Parsing.Dom.IDocumentType.SystemId
member.summary: The system identifier of the external subset.

member.name: P:Telerik.WinForms.Documents.FormatProviders.Html.Parsing.Dom.IDocumentType.InternalSubset
member.summary: The internal subset as a string.The actual content returned depends on how much information is available to the implementation. This may vary depending on various parameters, including the XML processor used to build the document.

member.name: T:Telerik.WinForms.Documents.FormatProviders.Html.Parsing.Dom.IDomImplementation
member.summary:
The DOMImplementation interface provides a number of methods for performing operations that are independent of any particular instance of the document object model.
See also the Document Object Model (DOM) Level 2 Core Specification.

member.name: M:Telerik.WinForms.Documents.FormatProviders.Html.Parsing.Dom.IDomImplementation.HasFeature(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Test if the DOM implementation implements a specific feature.
member.param: The name of the feature to test (case-insensitive). The values used by DOM features are defined throughout the DOM Level 2 specifications and listed in the section. The name must be an XML name. To avoid possible conflicts, as a convention, names referring to features defined outside the DOM specification should be made unique by reversing the name of the Internet domain name of the person (or the organization that the person belongs to) who defines the feature, component by component, and using this as a prefix. For instance, the W3C SVG Working Group defines the feature "TidyNet.svg".

This is the version number of the feature to test. In Level 2, the string can be either "2.0" or "1.0". If the version is not specified, supporting any version of the feature causes the method to return true.
member.returns: true if the feature is implemented in the specified version, false otherwise.

member.name: M:Telerik.WinForms.Documents.FormatProviders.Html.Parsing.Dom.IDomImplementation.CreateDocumentType(System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary:
Creates an empty DocumentType node. Entity declarations and notations are not made available. Entity reference expansions and default attribute additions do not occur. It is expected that a future version of the DOM will provide a way for populating a DocumentType.
HTML-only DOM implementations do not need to implement this method.
member.param: The qualified name of the document type to be created.
member.returns: A new DocumentType node with Node.ownerDocument set to null.
member.exception:
INVALID_CHARACTER_ERR: Raised if the specified qualified name contains an illegal character.
NAMESPACE_ERR: Raised if the qualifiedName is malformed.

member.name: M:Telerik.WinForms.Documents.FormatProviders.Html.Parsing.Dom.IDomImplementation.CreateDocument(System.String,System.String,Telerik.WinForms.Documents.FormatProviders.Html.Parsing.Dom.IDocumentType)
member.summary: Creates an XML Document object of the specified type with its document element. HTML-only DOM implementations do not need to implement this method.
member.param: The namespace URI of the document element to create.
The qualified name of the document element to be created.
The type of document to be created or null. When doctype is not null, its Node.ownerDocument attribute is set to the document being created.
member.returns: A new Document object.
member.exception:
INVALID_CHARACTER_ERR: Raised if the specified qualified name contains an illegal character.
NAMESPACE_ERR: Raised if the qualifiedName is malformed, if the qualifiedName has a prefix and the namespaceURI is null, or if the qualifiedName has a prefix that is "xml" and the namespaceURI is different from " http://www.w3.org/XML/1998/namespace" .
WRONG_DOCUMENT_ERR: Raised if doctype has already been used with a different document or was created from a different implementation.

member.name: T:Telerik.WinForms.Documents.FormatProviders.Html.Parsing.Dom.IElement
member.summary:
The Element interface represents an element in an HTML or XML document. Elements may have attributes associated with them; since the Element interface inherits from Node, the generic Node interface attribute attributes may be used to retrieve the set of all attributes for an element. There are methods on the Element interface to retrieve either an Attr object by name or an attribute value by name. In XML, where an attribute value may contain entity references, an Attr object should be retrieved to examine the possibly fairly complex sub-tree representing the attribute value. On the other hand, in HTML, where all attributes have simple string values, methods to directly access an attribute value can safely be used as a convenience.In DOM Level 2, the method normalize is inherited from the Node interface where it was moved.
See also the Document Object Model (DOM) Level 2 Core Specification.

member.name: P:Telerik.WinForms.Documents.FormatProviders.Html.Parsing.Dom.IElement.TagName
member.summary: The name of the element. For example, in: <elementExample id="demo"> ... </elementExample> , tagName has the value "elementExample". Note that this is case-preserving in XML, as are all of the operations of the DOM. The HTML DOM returns the tagName of an HTML element in the canonical uppercase form, regardless of the case in the source HTML document.

member.name: M:Telerik.WinForms.Documents.FormatProviders.Html.Parsing.Dom.IElement.GetAttribute(System.String)
member.summary: Retrieves an attribute value by name.
member.param: The name of the attribute to retrieve.
member.returns: The Attr value as a string, or the empty string if that attribute does not have a specified or default value.

member.name: M:Telerik.WinForms.Documents.FormatProviders.Html.Parsing.Dom.IElement.SetAttribute(System.String,System.String)
member.summary:
Adds a new attribute. If an attribute with that name is already present in the element, its value is changed to be that of the value parameter. This value is a simple string; it is not parsed as it is being set. So any markup (such as syntax to be recognized as an entity reference) is treated as literal text, and needs to be appropriately escaped by the implementation when it is written out. In order to assign an attribute value that contains entity references, the user must create an Attr node plus any Text and EntityReference nodes, build the appropriate subtree, and use setAttributeNode to assign it as the value of an attribute.
To set an attribute with a qualified name and namespace URI, use the setAttributeNS method.
member.param: The name of the attribute to create or alter.
Value to set in string form.
member.exception:
INVALID_CHARACTER_ERR: Raised if the specified name contains an illegal character.
NO_MODIFICATION_ALLOWED_ERR: Raised if this node is readonly.

To remove an attribute by local name and namespace URI, use the removeAttributeNS method.

member.exception: NO_MODIFICATION_ALLOWED_ERR: Raised if this node is readonly.

member.summary:
Adds a new attribute. If an attribute with the same local name and namespace URI is already present on the element, its prefix is changed to be the prefix part of the qualifiedName, and its value is changed to be the value parameter. This value is a simple string; it is not parsed as it is being set. So any markup (such as syntax to be recognized as an entity reference) is treated as literal text, and needs to be appropriately escaped by the implementation when it is written out. In order to assign an attribute value that contains entity references, the user must create an Attr node plus any Text and EntityReference nodes, build the appropriate subtree, and use setAttributeNodeNS or setAttributeNode to assign it as the value of an attribute.
HTML-only DOM implementations do not need to implement this method.

member.name: T:Telerik.WinForms.Documents.FormatProviders.Html.Parsing.Dom.IEntityReference
member.summary:
EntityReference objects may be inserted into the structure model when an entity reference is in the source document, or when the user wishes to insert an entity reference. Note that character references and references to predefined entities are considered to be expanded by the HTML or XML processor so that characters are represented by their Unicode equivalent rather than by an entity reference. Moreover, the XML processor may completely expand references to entities while building the structure model, instead of providing EntityReference objects. If it does provide such objects, then for a given EntityReference node, it may be that there is no Entity node representing the referenced entity. If such an Entity exists, then the subtree of the EntityReference node is in general a copy of the Entity node subtree. However, this may not be true when an entity contains an unbound namespace prefix. In such a case, because the namespace prefix resolution depends on where the entity reference is, the descendants of the EntityReference node may be bound to different namespace URIs.
As for Entity nodes, EntityReference nodes and all their descendants are readonly.
See also the Document Object Model (DOM) Level 2 Core Specification.

member.name: T:Telerik.WinForms.Documents.FormatProviders.Html.Parsing.Dom.INamedNodeMap
member.summary:
Objects implementing the NamedNodeMap interface are used to represent collections of nodes that can be accessed by name. Note that NamedNodeMap does not inherit from NodeList; NamedNodeMaps are not maintained in any particular order. Objects contained in an object implementing NamedNodeMap may also be accessed by an ordinal index, but this is simply to allow convenient enumeration of the contents of a NamedNodeMap, and does not imply that the DOM specifies an order to these Nodes.
NamedNodeMap objects in the DOM are live.
See also the Document Object Model (DOM) Level 2 Core Specification.

member.name: P:Telerik.WinForms.Documents.FormatProviders.Html.Parsing.Dom.INamedNodeMap.Length
member.summary: The number of nodes in this map. The range of valid child node indices is 0 to length-1 inclusive.

member.name: M:Telerik.WinForms.Documents.FormatProviders.Html.Parsing.Dom.INamedNodeMap.GetNamedItem(System.String)
member.summary: Retrieves a node specified by name.
member.param: The nodeName of a node to retrieve.
member.returns: A Node (of any type) with the specified nodeName, or null if it does not identify any node in this map.

member.name: M:Telerik.WinForms.Documents.FormatProviders.Html.Parsing.Dom.INamedNodeMap.SetNamedItem(Telerik.WinForms.Documents.FormatProviders.Html.Parsing.Dom.INode)
member.summary:
Adds a node using its nodeName attribute. If a node with that name is already present in this map, it is replaced by the new one.
As the nodeName attribute is used to derive the name which the node must be stored under, multiple nodes of certain types (those that have a "special" string value) cannot be stored as the names would clash. This is seen as preferable to allowing nodes to be aliased.
member.param: A node to store in this map. The node will later be accessible using the value of its nodeName attribute.
member.returns: If the new Node replaces an existing node the replaced Node is returned, otherwise null is returned.
member.exception:
WRONG_DOCUMENT_ERR: Raised if arg was created from a different document than the one that created this map.
NO_MODIFICATION_ALLOWED_ERR: Raised if this map is readonly.
INUSE_ATTRIBUTE_ERR: Raised if arg is an Attr that is already an attribute of another Element object. The DOM user must explicitly clone Attr nodes to re-use them in other elements.

member.param: The nodeName of the node to remove.
member.returns: The node removed from this map if a node with such a name exists.
member.exception:
NOT_FOUND_ERR: Raised if there is no node named name in this map.
NO_MODIFICATION_ALLOWED_ERR: Raised if this map is readonly.

member.returns: The node at the indexth position in the map, or null if that is not a valid index.

member.summary:
Removes a node specified by local name and namespace URI. A removed attribute may be known to have a default value when this map contains the attributes attached to an element, as returned by the attributes attribute of the Node interface. If so, an attribute immediately appears containing the default value as well as the corresponding namespace URI, local name, and prefix when applicable.
HTML-only DOM implementations do not need to implement this method.
member.param: The namespace URI of the node to remove.
The local name of the node to remove.
member.returns: The node removed from this map if a node with such a local name and namespace URI exists.
member.exception:
